Header.Title: BOEING SERVICE BULLETIN 737-00-1028
Header.Subject: ADMINISTRATIVE GENERAL - Aircraft General - Angle of Attack Sensor System Test and Operational Readiness Flight

Reason.Text: This service bulletin provides mandated instructions to perform an Angle of Attack (AOA) Sensor System Test and an Operational Readiness Flight.

Steps.Step: Perform an Angle of Attack (AOA) Sensor System Test.

Compliance.FAA_AD_Possibility: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) may release an Airworthiness Directive related to this service bulletin.

Action.Description: Perform Angle of Attack (AOA) Sensor System Test.

Task.Description: Angle of Attack (AOA) Sensor System Test

Notes.Note: Manual titles are referred to by acronyms. Refer to Paragraph 1.J., References, for definitions.
Follow all warnings and cautions given in the specified manual sections.
Compliance times are in Paragraph 1.E., Compliance.

Step.Description: Perform Angle of Attack (AOA) Sensor System Test of the left and right AOA sensors in accordance with 737-8/-9 AMM 34-21-05-730-801 dated Jul 15/2020 or later Boeing approved revisions.
Perform an Operational Readiness Flight including flaps retracted flight at or above 20,000 ft. MSL. Refer to Appendix A.
